page.title: Atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki

rev.comment: replace image with more interesting one
ISBN formatting problems &/or general fixes using [[WP:AWB|AWB]]
/* Prelude to the bombings */ German bomb development program much smaller than thought
Minor spelling fix in Nagasaki bombing section
/* Choice of targets */ disambig Niigata -> Niigata, Niigata
fixed photo that was throwing off page layout
RV. mass-to-energy figure is suspect, and moveing of Bolton text puts it in the wrong place
/* Inherently immoral */ rewrote paragraph for clarity, ease of read
/* Inherently immoral */ re-added terrorism section, removed Bolton (who is very much NOT an oppositionist)
Why are you "sure it is wrong" ? A seemingly reliable source listed that amount (footnote 28), and my calcs on the bottom of the talk page confirm it, even though I had my doubts, as well.
/* The bombing */ I'm sure the figure of "1.76 kg" of matter converted into energy is wrong, but am having trouble finding a reliable figure (and I don't want to do the math), so removing that
/* The bombing */ Fixed incorrect mass to match source.
BOT - moving cia links to https, Replaced: http://www.cia.gov → https://www.cia.gov,
/* Nagasaki during World War II */ NPOV, and it seems to extrapolate from one cited experience for all of their experiences (and most of those cites no longer work...)
/* The bombing */ fixed incorrect value of mass converted into energy. 1 g is what you get from m=E/c2 with E of 21 kiloton TNT.
the {{cquote}} tag looks absurd and childish, IMO, so I've replaced them with regular quotes
/* Opposition */ # That the bombings were inherently immoral due to the massive civilian casualties.
/* Militarily unnecessary */ completely removed the quote section I added, intigrated it into this section instead.
/* See also */ "Japan was already defeated and dropping the bomb was completely unnecessary." Dwight D. Eisenhower, Supreme Commander of the Allied Forces in Europe and future president of the United
/* Prelude to the bombings */ Specifying General Groves is on left of picture
/* Descriptions of the bombings */ link corrected
/* Films about the events */ corrected link
Redirect bypass from [[Rome Statute]] to [[Rome Statute of the International Criminal Court]] using [[:en:Wikipedia:Tools/Navigation_popups|popups]]
/* Opposition */ Putting Camu quote in correct section, fixing English, other small edits
repeating the title text in the opening paragraph just doesn't work well with this article. Also, "main article" doesn't apply to H. & N., as those articles are about the cities, not the bombings
here is an attempt to make this work out better with the title and to avoid so much redundancy in a single sentence
MOS says to only do that when it works well and is not banal, which that particular version was (aside from inaccurate -- the bombings did not BOTH occur on August 6)
this is conventional, title of article should be highlighted, equating it with [[attack on pearl harbor]], it should always be bolded.
/* Opposition */ formatting fixes, slight trimming to "Opposition" additions
/* See also */ Added appropriate link (see target page)
Argh; oops again. I think I got it right this time
/* Debate over bombings */ Oops, double-pasted last edit
/* Opposition */ rewrite to this section, mostly rearranging existing material
rv to last by KB, edits by banned Parkinsons/General Tojo
revert KB (now in breach of 3RR) - SP's must be proven, not merely assumed when ever somebody disagrees with you
3RR does not apply to reverting banned users
revert KB - nobody but KB wanted them removed - so is everyone except KB irrational ? 3RR now applies
Who else but G.T. would be so irrational as to use his first edits to insist upon an utterly meaningless addition to this article?
revert KB - is anyone who reverts KB automatically a SP !
reverting sockpuppet of banned user:General Tojo
/* Opposition */ rm extranious picture of president
/* Debate over bombings */ rm extranious picture of president
/* Camp 14 */ rm unclear and marginally-relevant section
it was not the Enola Gay--I will footnote this and all these related corrections
Tinian time was an hour later
removing reference to "war crime" from intro, as I don't think it's supportable to say that "the general public opinion" in Japan would agree with that term

Balance the US and Japanese summaries
Revert Bunker - According to the records ONLY Physio was merely claimed but not proven to be Tojo SP
Physio, Jan Akkerman and 88.106.172.134 are sockpuppets of General Tojo/Parkinsons; an indefinately blocked user.
/* Hiroshima */ ...nor does this image of Enola Gay
In addition to adding to an overabundance of images, the Bockscar photo adds no worthwhile information to the article
The pictures are good. If you don't like the text change it.
/* Nagasaki during World War II */ you can't have the text just be a skinny little bit in between two images. it is definitely against our [[WP:MOS]]
/* Nagasaki during World War II */ way too many photos up here

RV; I don't think the new images are a good addition to the article
title and main point of the article
